edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Interface AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ScElGamalOnGroupElement

    public interface AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc
extends AsymmetricEnc
    Interface for asymmetric multiplicative homomorphic encryption. Such encryption schemes can compute the encryption of m1*m2, given only the public key and the encryptions of m1 and m2.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

      • multiply

        AsymmetricCiphertext multiply(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                            AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2,
                            java.math.BigInteger r)
        Receives two ciphertexts and return their multiplication.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the multiply function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional multiply function that gets the random value from the user.

        Parameters:
        cipher1 -
        cipher2 -
        r - The random value used in the function.
        Returns:
        the multiplication result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertexts do not match this asymmetric encryption.
